text: Welcome to Ulvik – Poetry, Nature, and Local Living in the Heart of HardangerUlvik is a small, welcoming village at the innermost end of the Hardangerfjord. Surrounded by steep mountains, green valleys, and fruit orchards, it offers a wide range of nature experiences, cultural activities, and local food traditions.Ulvik is a proud member of Cittaslow, the international movement for slow living, quality of life, and sustainable tourism. It is also known as Norway’s poetry village, the home of celebrated poet Olav H. Hauge.Here, you can walk the same paths that inspired Hauge’s writing, visit the Olav H. Hauge Centre, and enjoy a slower rhythm of life in harmony with nature and local culture.Ulvik is also home to Norway’s only Fruit and Cider Route, where you can visit family-run farms, taste local cider, and learn about Hardanger’s proud fruit-growing traditions.Whether you prefer hiking in the mountains, kayaking on the fjord, or discovering local art and history, Ulvik has something for everyone.Plan your stay in Ulvik and experience the best of the fjord region – at your own pace.

Hardanger Juice and Ciderfactory grows a wide range of apple which are processed into tasty beverages such as its  highly acclaimed apple cider, juice, dessert wine and brandy. The farm offers tours and cider-tastings, as well as a selection of goods in their farm shop.

At the heart of Ulvik towers Ulvik Church. The stunning traditional cross-shaped parish church dons beautiful rose-painted interior by local artist Lars Osa. The church is open to visitors who wish to see the traditions and culture of local Christianity up close and personal.
Ulvik Frukt & Cideri is of the three farms part of the only Fruit- and Cidertrail in Norway. The farm offers tours and samples of their farmyard produce, including apple juice and cider.
